apis.name: Application settings API
apis.description: These API calls allow you to read and modify GitLab instance application settings as they appear in /admin/application_settings/general. You must be an administrator to perform this action.

apis.name: Get current application settings
apis.description: Users on GitLab Premium or Ultimate may also see the file_template_project_id, delayed_project_deletion, deletion_adjourned_period, or the geo_node_allowed_ips parameters:

apis.name: Change application settings
apis.description: Users on GitLab Premium or Ultimate may also see these parameters:

apis.name: List of settings that can be accessed via API calls
apis.description: In general, all settings are optional. Certain settings though, if enabled, require other settings to be set to function properly. These requirements are listed in the descriptions of the relevant settings.

attributes.name: admin_mode
attributes.description: Require administrators to enable Admin Mode by re-authenticating for administrative tasks.

attributes.name: admin_notification_email
attributes.description: Deprecated: Use abuse_notification_email instead. If set, abuse reports are sent to this address. Abuse reports are always available in the Admin Area.

attributes.name: abuse_notification_email
attributes.description: If set, abuse reports are sent to this address. Abuse reports are always available in the Admin Area.

attributes.name: after_sign_out_path
attributes.description: Where to redirect users after logout.

attributes.name: after_sign_up_text
attributes.description: Text shown to the user after signing up.

attributes.name: akismet_api_key
attributes.description: API key for Akismet spam protection.

attributes.name: akismet_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: akismet_api_key) Enable or disable Akismet spam protection.

attributes.name: allow_group_owners_to_manage_ldap
attributes.description: Set to true to allow group owners to manage LDAP.

attributes.name: allow_local_requests_from_hooks_and_services
attributes.description: (Deprecated: Use allow_local_requests_from_web_hooks_and_services instead) Allow requests to the local network from hooks and services.

attributes.name: allow_local_requests_from_system_hooks
attributes.description: Allow requests to the local network from system hooks.

attributes.name: allow_local_requests_from_web_hooks_and_services
attributes.description: Allow requests to the local network from web hooks and services.

attributes.name: archive_builds_in_human_readable
attributes.description: Set the duration for which the jobs are considered as old and expired. After that time passes, the jobs are archived and no longer able to be retried. Make it empty to never expire jobs. It has to be no less than 1 day, for example: 15 days, 1 month, 2 years.

attributes.name: asset_proxy_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: asset_proxy_url) Enable proxying of assets. GitLab restart is required to apply changes.

attributes.name: asset_proxy_secret_key
attributes.description: Shared secret with the asset proxy server. GitLab restart is required to apply changes.

attributes.name: asset_proxy_url
attributes.description: URL of the asset proxy server. GitLab restart is required to apply changes.

attributes.name: asset_proxy_whitelist
attributes.description: (Deprecated: Use asset_proxy_allowlist instead) Assets that match these domain(s) are not proxied. Wildcards allowed. Your GitLab installation URL is automatically allowlisted. GitLab restart is required to apply changes.

attributes.name: asset_proxy_allowlist
attributes.description: Assets that match these domain(s) are not proxied. Wildcards allowed. Your GitLab installation URL is automatically allowlisted. GitLab restart is required to apply changes.

attributes.name: authorized_keys_enabled
attributes.description: By default, we write to the authorized_keys file to support Git over SSH without additional configuration. GitLab can be optimized to authenticate SSH keys via the database file. Only disable this if you have configured your OpenSSH server to use the AuthorizedKeysCommand.

attributes.name: auto_devops_domain
attributes.description: Specify a domain to use by default for every project’s Auto Review Apps and Auto Deploy stages.

attributes.name: auto_devops_enabled
attributes.description: Enable Auto DevOps for projects by default. It automatically builds, tests, and deploys applications based on a predefined CI/CD configuration.

attributes.name: automatic_purchased_storage_allocation
attributes.description: Enabling this permits automatic allocation of purchased storage in a namespace.

attributes.name: check_namespace_plan
attributes.description: Enabling this makes only licensed EE features available to projects if the project namespace’s plan includes the feature or if the project is public.

attributes.name: commit_email_hostname
attributes.description: Custom hostname (for private commit emails).

attributes.name: container_expiration_policies_enable_historic_entries
attributes.description: Enable cleanup policies for all projects.

attributes.name: container_registry_cleanup_tags_service_max_list_size
attributes.description: The maximum number of tags that can be deleted in a single execution of cleanup policies.

attributes.name: container_registry_delete_tags_service_timeout
attributes.description: The maximum time, in seconds, that the cleanup process can take to delete a batch of tags for cleanup policies.

attributes.name: container_registry_expiration_policies_caching
attributes.description: Caching during the execution of cleanup policies.

attributes.name: container_registry_expiration_policies_worker_capacity
attributes.description: Number of workers for cleanup policies.

attributes.name: container_registry_token_expire_delay
attributes.description: Container Registry token duration in minutes.

attributes.name: deactivate_dormant_users
attributes.description: Enable automatic deactivation of dormant users.

attributes.name: default_artifacts_expire_in
attributes.description: Set the default expiration time for each job’s artifacts.

attributes.name: default_branch_name
attributes.description: Instance-level custom initial branch name (introduced in GitLab 13.2).

attributes.name: default_branch_protection
attributes.description: Determine if developers can push to the default branch. Can take: 0 (not protected, both users with the Developer role or Maintainer role can push new commits and force push), 1 (partially protected, users with the Developer role or Maintainer role can push new commits, but cannot force push) or 2 (fully protected, users with the Developer or Maintainer role cannot push new commits, but users with the Developer or Maintainer role can; no one can force push) as a parameter. Default is 2.

attributes.name: default_ci_config_path
attributes.description: Default CI/CD configuration file and path for new projects (.gitlab-ci.yml if not set).

attributes.name: default_group_visibility
attributes.description: What visibility level new groups receive. Can take private, internal and public as a parameter. Default is private.

attributes.name: default_project_creation
attributes.description: Default project creation protection. Can take: 0 (No one), 1 (Maintainers) or 2 (Developers + Maintainers)

attributes.name: default_project_visibility
attributes.description: What visibility level new projects receive. Can take private, internal and public as a parameter. Default is private.

attributes.name: default_projects_limit
attributes.description: Project limit per user. Default is 100000.

attributes.name: default_snippet_visibility
attributes.description: What visibility level new snippets receive. Can take private, internal and public as a parameter. Default is private.

attributes.name: delayed_project_deletion
attributes.description: Enable delayed project deletion by default in new groups. Default is false.

attributes.name: deletion_adjourned_period
attributes.description: The number of days to wait before deleting a project or group that is marked for deletion. Value must be between 0 and 90.

attributes.name: diff_max_patch_bytes
attributes.description: Maximum diff patch size, in bytes.

attributes.name: diff_max_files
attributes.description: Maximum files in a diff.

attributes.name: diff_max_lines
attributes.description: Maximum lines in a diff.

attributes.name: disable_feed_token
attributes.description: Disable display of RSS/Atom and calendar feed tokens (introduced in GitLab 13.7)

attributes.name: disabled_oauth_sign_in_sources
attributes.description: Disabled OAuth sign-in sources.

attributes.name: dns_rebinding_protection_enabled
attributes.description: Enforce DNS rebinding attack protection.

attributes.name: domain_denylist_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: domain_denylist) Allows blocking sign-ups from emails from specific domains.

attributes.name: domain_denylist
attributes.description: Users with email addresses that match these domain(s) cannot sign up. Wildcards allowed. Use separate lines for multiple entries. Ex: domain.com, *.domain.com.

attributes.name: domain_allowlist
attributes.description: Force people to use only corporate emails for sign-up. Default is null, meaning there is no restriction.

attributes.name: dsa_key_restriction
attributes.description: The minimum allowed bit length of an uploaded DSA key. Default is 0 (no restriction). -1 disables DSA keys.

attributes.name: ecdsa_key_restriction
attributes.description: The minimum allowed curve size (in bits) of an uploaded ECDSA key. Default is 0 (no restriction). -1 disables ECDSA keys.

attributes.name: ecdsa_sk_key_restriction
attributes.description: The minimum allowed curve size (in bits) of an uploaded ECDSA_SK key. Default is 0 (no restriction). -1 disables ECDSA_SK keys.

attributes.name: ed25519_key_restriction
attributes.description: The minimum allowed curve size (in bits) of an uploaded ED25519 key. Default is 0 (no restriction). -1 disables ED25519 keys.

attributes.name: ed25519_sk_key_restriction
attributes.description: The minimum allowed curve size (in bits) of an uploaded ED25519_SK key. Default is 0 (no restriction). -1 disables ED25519_SK keys.

attributes.name: eks_access_key_id
attributes.description: AWS IAM access key ID.

attributes.name: eks_account_id
attributes.description: Amazon account ID.

attributes.name: eks_integration_enabled
attributes.description: Enable integration with Amazon EKS.

attributes.name: eks_secret_access_key
attributes.description: AWS IAM secret access key.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_aws_access_key
attributes.description: AWS IAM access key.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_aws_region
attributes.description: The AWS region the Elasticsearch domain is configured.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_aws_secret_access_key
attributes.description: AWS IAM secret access key.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_aws
attributes.description: Enable the use of AWS hosted Elasticsearch.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_indexed_field_length_limit
attributes.description: Maximum size of text fields to index by Elasticsearch. 0 value means no limit. This does not apply to repository and wiki indexing.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_indexed_file_size_limit_kb
attributes.description: Maximum size of repository and wiki files that are indexed by Elasticsearch.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_indexing
attributes.description: Enable Elasticsearch indexing.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_limit_indexing
attributes.description: Limit Elasticsearch to index certain namespaces and projects.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_max_bulk_concurrency
attributes.description: Maximum concurrency of Elasticsearch bulk requests per indexing operation. This only applies to repository indexing operations.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_max_bulk_size_mb
attributes.description: Maximum size of Elasticsearch bulk indexing requests in MB. This only applies to repository indexing operations.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_namespace_ids
attributes.description: The namespaces to index via Elasticsearch if elasticsearch_limit_indexing is enabled.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_project_ids
attributes.description: The projects to index via Elasticsearch if elasticsearch_limit_indexing is enabled.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_search
attributes.description: Enable Elasticsearch search.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_url
attributes.description: The URL to use for connecting to Elasticsearch. Use a comma-separated list to support cluster (for example, http://localhost:9200, http://localhost:9201").

attributes.name: elasticsearch_username
attributes.description: The username of your Elasticsearch instance.

attributes.name: elasticsearch_password
attributes.description: The password of your Elasticsearch instance.

attributes.name: email_additional_text
attributes.description: Additional text added to the bottom of every email for legal/auditing/compliance reasons.

attributes.name: email_author_in_body
attributes.description: Some email servers do not support overriding the email sender name. Enable this option to include the name of the author of the issue, merge request or comment in the email body instead.

attributes.name: enabled_git_access_protocol
attributes.description: Enabled protocols for Git access. Allowed values are: ssh, http, and nil to allow both protocols.

attributes.name: enforce_namespace_storage_limit
attributes.description: Enabling this permits enforcement of namespace storage limits.

attributes.name: enforce_terms
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: terms) Enforce application ToS to all users.

attributes.name: external_auth_client_cert
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: external_auth_client_key) The certificate to use to authenticate with the external authorization service.

attributes.name: external_auth_client_key_pass
attributes.description: Passphrase to use for the private key when authenticating with the external service this is encrypted when stored.

attributes.name: external_auth_client_key
attributes.description: Private key for the certificate when authentication is required for the external authorization service, this is encrypted when stored.

attributes.name: external_authorization_service_default_label
attributes.description: The default classification label to use when requesting authorization and no classification label has been specified on the project.

attributes.name: external_authorization_service_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: external_authorization_service_default_label, external_authorization_service_timeout and external_authorization_service_url) Enable using an external authorization service for accessing projects.

attributes.name: external_authorization_service_timeout
attributes.description: The timeout after which an authorization request is aborted, in seconds. When a request times out, access is denied to the user. (min: 0.001, max: 10, step: 0.001).

attributes.name: external_authorization_service_url
attributes.description: URL to which authorization requests are directed.

attributes.name: external_pipeline_validation_service_url
attributes.description: URL to use for pipeline validation requests.

attributes.name: external_pipeline_validation_service_token
attributes.description: Optional. Token to include as the X-Gitlab-Token header in requests to the URL in external_pipeline_validation_service_url.

attributes.name: external_pipeline_validation_service_timeout
attributes.description: How long to wait for a response from the pipeline validation service. Assumes OK if it times out.

attributes.name: file_template_project_id
attributes.description: The ID of a project to load custom file templates from.

attributes.name: first_day_of_week
attributes.description: Start day of the week for calendar views and date pickers. Valid values are 0 (default) for Sunday, 1 for Monday, and 6 for Saturday.

attributes.name: geo_node_allowed_ips
attributes.description: Comma-separated list of IPs and CIDRs of allowed secondary nodes. For example, 1.1.1.1, 2.2.2.0/24.

attributes.name: geo_status_timeout
attributes.description: The amount of seconds after which a request to get a secondary node status times out.

attributes.name: git_two_factor_session_expiry
attributes.description: Maximum duration (in minutes) of a session for Git operations when 2FA is enabled.

attributes.name: gitaly_timeout_default
attributes.description: Default Gitaly timeout, in seconds. This timeout is not enforced for Git fetch/push operations or Sidekiq jobs. Set to 0 to disable timeouts.

attributes.name: gitaly_timeout_fast
attributes.description: Gitaly fast operation timeout, in seconds. Some Gitaly operations are expected to be fast. If they exceed this threshold, there may be a problem with a storage shard and ‘failing fast’ can help maintain the stability of the GitLab instance. Set to 0 to disable timeouts.

attributes.name: gitaly_timeout_medium
attributes.description: Medium Gitaly timeout, in seconds. This should be a value between the Fast and the Default timeout. Set to 0 to disable timeouts.

attributes.name: grafana_enabled
attributes.description: Enable Grafana.

attributes.name: grafana_url
attributes.description: Grafana URL.

attributes.name: gravatar_enabled
attributes.description: Enable Gravatar.

attributes.name: hashed_storage_enabled
attributes.description: Create new projects using hashed storage paths: Enable immutable, hash-based paths and repository names to store repositories on disk. This prevents repositories from having to be moved or renamed when the Project URL changes and may improve disk I/O performance. (Always enabled in GitLab versions 13.0 and later, configuration is scheduled for removal in 14.0)

attributes.name: help_page_hide_commercial_content
attributes.description: Hide marketing-related entries from help.

attributes.name: help_page_support_url
attributes.description: Alternate support URL for help page and help dropdown.

attributes.name: help_page_text
attributes.description: Custom text displayed on the help page.

attributes.name: help_text
attributes.description: GitLab server administrator information.

attributes.name: hide_third_party_offers
attributes.description: Do not display offers from third parties in GitLab.

attributes.name: home_page_url
attributes.description: Redirect to this URL when not logged in.

attributes.name: housekeeping_bitmaps_enabled
attributes.description: Enable Git pack file bitmap creation.

attributes.name: housekeeping_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: housekeeping_bitmaps_enabled, housekeeping_full_repack_period, housekeeping_gc_period, and housekeeping_incremental_repack_period) Enable or disable Git housekeeping.

attributes.name: housekeeping_full_repack_period
attributes.description: Number of Git pushes after which an incremental git repack is run.

attributes.name: housekeeping_gc_period
attributes.description: Number of Git pushes after which git gc is run.

attributes.name: housekeeping_incremental_repack_period
attributes.description: Number of Git pushes after which an incremental git repack is run.

attributes.name: html_emails_enabled
attributes.description: Enable HTML emails.

attributes.name: import_sources
attributes.description: Sources to allow project import from, possible values: github, bitbucket, bitbucket_server, gitlab, fogbugz, git, gitlab_project, gitea, manifest, and phabricator.

attributes.name: in_product_marketing_emails_enabled
attributes.description: Enable in-product marketing emails. Enabled by default.

attributes.name: invisible_captcha_enabled
attributes.description: Enable Invisible CAPTCHA spam detection during sign-up. Disabled by default.

attributes.name: issues_create_limit
attributes.description: Max number of issue creation requests per minute per user. Disabled by default.

attributes.name: keep_latest_artifact
attributes.description: Prevent the deletion of the artifacts from the most recent successful jobs, regardless of the expiry time. Enabled by default.

attributes.name: local_markdown_version
attributes.description: Increase this value when any cached Markdown should be invalidated.

attributes.name: mailgun_signing_key
attributes.description: The Mailgun HTTP webhook signing key for receiving events from webhook.

attributes.name: mailgun_events_enabled
attributes.description: Enable Mailgun event receiver.

attributes.name: maintenance_mode_message
attributes.description: Message displayed when instance is in maintenance mode.

attributes.name: maintenance_mode
attributes.description: When instance is in maintenance mode, non-administrative users can sign in with read-only access and make read-only API requests.

attributes.name: max_artifacts_size
attributes.description: Maximum artifacts size in MB.

attributes.name: max_attachment_size
attributes.description: Limit attachment size in MB.

attributes.name: max_import_size
attributes.description: Maximum import size in MB. 0 for unlimited. Default = 0 (unlimited) Modified from 50MB to 0 in GitLab 13.8.

attributes.name: max_pages_size
attributes.description: Maximum size of pages repositories in MB.

attributes.name: max_personal_access_token_lifetime
attributes.description: Maximum allowable lifetime for personal access tokens in days.

attributes.name: max_ssh_key_lifetime
attributes.description: Maximum allowable lifetime for SSH keys in days. Introduced in GitLab 14.6.

attributes.name: metrics_method_call_threshold
attributes.description: A method call is only tracked when it takes longer than the given amount of milliseconds.

attributes.name: mirror_available
attributes.description: Allow repository mirroring to configured by project Maintainers. If disabled, only Administrators can configure repository mirroring.

attributes.name: mirror_capacity_threshold
attributes.description: Minimum capacity to be available before scheduling more mirrors preemptively.

attributes.name: mirror_max_capacity
attributes.description: Maximum number of mirrors that can be synchronizing at the same time.

attributes.name: mirror_max_delay
attributes.description: Maximum time (in minutes) between updates that a mirror can have when scheduled to synchronize.

attributes.name: npm_package_requests_forwarding
attributes.description: Use npmjs.org as a default remote repository when the package is not found in the GitLab Package Registry for npm.

attributes.name: pypi_package_requests_forwarding
attributes.description: Use pypi.org as a default remote repository when the package is not found in the GitLab Package Registry for PyPI.

attributes.name: outbound_local_requests_whitelist
attributes.description: Define a list of trusted domains or IP addresses to which local requests are allowed when local requests for hooks and services are disabled.

attributes.name: pages_domain_verification_enabled
attributes.description: Require users to prove ownership of custom domains. Domain verification is an essential security measure for public GitLab sites. Users are required to demonstrate they control a domain before it is enabled.

attributes.name: password_authentication_enabled_for_git
attributes.description: Enable authentication for Git over HTTP(S) via a GitLab account password. Default is true.

attributes.name: password_authentication_enabled_for_web
attributes.description: Enable authentication for the web interface via a GitLab account password. Default is true.

attributes.name: performance_bar_allowed_group_id
attributes.description: (Deprecated: Use performance_bar_allowed_group_path instead) Path of the group that is allowed to toggle the performance bar.

attributes.name: performance_bar_allowed_group_path
attributes.description: Path of the group that is allowed to toggle the performance bar.

attributes.name: performance_bar_enabled
attributes.description: (Deprecated: Pass performance_bar_allowed_group_path: nil instead) Allow enabling the performance bar.

attributes.name: personal_access_token_prefix
attributes.description: Prefix for all generated personal access tokens.

attributes.name: plantuml_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: plantuml_url) Enable PlantUML integration. Default is false.

attributes.name: plantuml_url
attributes.description: The PlantUML instance URL for integration.

attributes.name: polling_interval_multiplier
attributes.description: Interval multiplier used by endpoints that perform polling. Set to 0 to disable polling.

attributes.name: project_export_enabled
attributes.description: Enable project export.

attributes.name: prometheus_metrics_enabled
attributes.description: Enable Prometheus metrics.

attributes.name: protected_ci_variables
attributes.description: CI/CD variables are protected by default.

attributes.name: pseudonymizer_enabled
attributes.description: When enabled, GitLab runs a background job that produces pseudonymized CSVs of the GitLab database to upload to your configured object storage directory.

attributes.name: push_event_activities_limit
attributes.description: Number of changes (branches or tags) in a single push to determine whether individual push events or bulk push events are created. Bulk push events are created if it surpasses that value.

attributes.name: push_event_hooks_limit
attributes.description: Number of changes (branches or tags) in a single push to determine whether webhooks and services fire or not. Webhooks and services aren’t submitted if it surpasses that value.

attributes.name: rate_limiting_response_text
attributes.description: When rate limiting is enabled via the throttle_* settings, send this plain text response when a rate limit is exceeded. ‘Retry later’ is sent if this is blank.

attributes.name: raw_blob_request_limit
attributes.description: Max number of requests per minute for each raw path. Default: 300. To disable throttling set to 0.

attributes.name: user_email_lookup_limit
attributes.description: caution Deprecated in GitLab 14.9 will be removed in 15.0. Replaced by search_rate_limit. Max number of requests per minute for email lookup. Default: 60. To disable throttling set to 0.

attributes.name: search_rate_limit
attributes.description: Max number of requests per minute for performing a search while authenticated. Default: 30. To disable throttling set to 0.

attributes.name: search_rate_limit_unauthenticated
attributes.description: Max number of requests per minute for performing a search while unauthenticated. Default: 10. To disable throttling set to 0.

attributes.name: recaptcha_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: recaptcha_private_key and recaptcha_site_key) Enable reCAPTCHA.

attributes.name: recaptcha_private_key
attributes.description: Private key for reCAPTCHA.

attributes.name: recaptcha_site_key
attributes.description: Site key for reCAPTCHA.

attributes.name: receive_max_input_size
attributes.description: Maximum push size (MB).

attributes.name: repository_checks_enabled
attributes.description: GitLab periodically runs git fsck in all project and wiki repositories to look for silent disk corruption issues.

attributes.name: repository_size_limit
attributes.description: Size limit per repository (MB)

attributes.name: repository_storages_weighted
attributes.description: (GitLab 13.1 and later) Hash of names of taken from gitlab.yml to weights. New projects are created in one of these stores, chosen by a weighted random selection.

attributes.name: repository_storages
attributes.description: (GitLab 13.0 and earlier) List of names of enabled storage paths, taken from gitlab.yml. New projects are created in one of these stores, chosen at random.

attributes.name: require_admin_approval_after_user_signup
attributes.description: When enabled, any user that signs up for an account using the registration form is placed under a Pending approval state and has to be explicitly approved by an administrator.

attributes.name: require_two_factor_authentication
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: two_factor_grace_period) Require all users to set up Two-factor authentication.

attributes.name: restricted_visibility_levels
attributes.description: Selected levels cannot be used by non-Administrator users for groups, projects or snippets. Can take private, internal and public as a parameter. Default is null which means there is no restriction.

attributes.name: rsa_key_restriction
attributes.description: The minimum allowed bit length of an uploaded RSA key. Default is 0 (no restriction). -1 disables RSA keys.

attributes.name: send_user_confirmation_email
attributes.description: Send confirmation email on sign-up.

attributes.name: session_expire_delay
attributes.description: Session duration in minutes. GitLab restart is required to apply changes.

attributes.name: shared_runners_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: shared_runners_text and shared_runners_minutes) Enable shared runners for new projects.

attributes.name: shared_runners_minutes
attributes.description: Set the maximum number of CI/CD minutes that a group can use on shared runners per month.

attributes.name: shared_runners_text
attributes.description: Shared runners text.

attributes.name: sidekiq_job_limiter_mode
attributes.description: track or compress. Sets the behavior for Sidekiq job size limits. Default: ‘compress’.

attributes.name: sidekiq_job_limiter_compression_threshold_bytes
attributes.description: The threshold in bytes at which Sidekiq jobs are compressed before being stored in Redis. Default: 100 000 bytes (100KB).

attributes.name: sidekiq_job_limiter_limit_bytes
attributes.description: The threshold in bytes at which Sidekiq jobs are rejected. Default: 0 bytes (doesn’t reject any job).

attributes.name: sign_in_text
attributes.description: Text on the login page.

attributes.name: signin_enabled
attributes.description: (Deprecated: Use password_authentication_enabled_for_web instead) Flag indicating if password authentication is enabled for the web interface.

attributes.name: signup_enabled
attributes.description: Enable registration. Default is true.

attributes.name: slack_app_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: slack_app_id, slack_app_secret and slack_app_secret) Enable Slack app.

attributes.name: slack_app_id
attributes.description: The app ID of the Slack-app.

attributes.name: slack_app_secret
attributes.description: The app secret of the Slack-app.

attributes.name: slack_app_verification_token
attributes.description: The verification token of the Slack-app.

attributes.name: snippet_size_limit
attributes.description: Max snippet content size in bytes. Default: 52428800 Bytes (50MB).

attributes.name: snowplow_app_id
attributes.description: The Snowplow site name / application ID. (for example, gitlab)

attributes.name: snowplow_collector_hostname
attributes.description: The Snowplow collector hostname. (for example, snowplow.trx.gitlab.net)

attributes.name: snowplow_cookie_domain
attributes.description: The Snowplow cookie domain. (for example, .gitlab.com)

attributes.name: snowplow_enabled
attributes.description: Enable snowplow tracking.

attributes.name: sourcegraph_enabled
attributes.description: Enables Sourcegraph integration. Default is false. If enabled, requires sourcegraph_url.

attributes.name: sourcegraph_public_only
attributes.description: Blocks Sourcegraph from being loaded on private and internal projects. Default is true.

attributes.name: sourcegraph_url
attributes.description: The Sourcegraph instance URL for integration.

attributes.name: spam_check_endpoint_enabled
attributes.description: Enables spam checking using external Spam Check API endpoint. Default is false.

attributes.name: spam_check_endpoint_url
attributes.description: URL of the external Spamcheck service endpoint. Valid URI schemes are grpc or tls. Specifying tls forces communication to be encrypted.

attributes.name: spam_check_api_key
attributes.description: API key used by GitLab for accessing the Spam Check service endpoint.

attributes.name: suggest_pipeline_enabled
attributes.description: Enable pipeline suggestion banner.

attributes.name: terminal_max_session_time
attributes.description: Maximum time for web terminal websocket connection (in seconds). Set to 0 for unlimited time.

attributes.name: terms
attributes.description: (Required by: enforce_terms) Markdown content for the ToS.

attributes.name: throttle_authenticated_api_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: throttle_authenticated_api_period_in_seconds and throttle_authenticated_api_requests_per_period) Enable authenticated API request rate limit. Helps reduce request volume (for example, from crawlers or abusive bots).

attributes.name: throttle_authenticated_api_period_in_seconds
attributes.description: Rate limit period (in seconds).

attributes.name: throttle_authenticated_api_requests_per_period
attributes.description: Maximum requests per period per user.

attributes.name: throttle_authenticated_web_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: throttle_authenticated_web_period_in_seconds and throttle_authenticated_web_requests_per_period) Enable authenticated web request rate limit. Helps reduce request volume (for example, from crawlers or abusive bots).

attributes.name: throttle_authenticated_web_period_in_seconds
attributes.description: Rate limit period (in seconds).

attributes.name: throttle_authenticated_web_requests_per_period
attributes.description: Maximum requests per period per user.

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_enabled
attributes.description: (Deprecated in GitLab 14.3. Use throttle_unauthenticated_web_enabled or throttle_unauthenticated_api_enabled instead.) (If enabled, requires: throttle_unauthenticated_period_in_seconds and throttle_unauthenticated_requests_per_period) Enable unauthenticated web request rate limit. Helps reduce request volume (for example, from crawlers or abusive bots).

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_period_in_seconds
attributes.description: (Deprecated in GitLab 14.3. Use throttle_unauthenticated_web_period_in_seconds or throttle_unauthenticated_api_period_in_seconds instead.) Rate limit period in seconds.

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_requests_per_period
attributes.description: (Deprecated in GitLab 14.3. Use throttle_unauthenticated_web_requests_per_period or throttle_unauthenticated_api_requests_per_period instead.) Max requests per period per IP.

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_api_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: throttle_unauthenticated_api_period_in_seconds and throttle_unauthenticated_api_requests_per_period) Enable unauthenticated API request rate limit. Helps reduce request volume (for example, from crawlers or abusive bots).

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_api_period_in_seconds
attributes.description: Rate limit period in seconds.

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_api_requests_per_period
attributes.description: Max requests per period per IP.

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_web_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: throttle_unauthenticated_web_period_in_seconds and throttle_unauthenticated_web_requests_per_period) Enable unauthenticated web request rate limit. Helps reduce request volume (for example, from crawlers or abusive bots).

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_web_period_in_seconds
attributes.description: Rate limit period in seconds.

attributes.name: throttle_unauthenticated_web_requests_per_period
attributes.description: Max requests per period per IP.

attributes.name: time_tracking_limit_to_hours
attributes.description: Limit display of time tracking units to hours. Default is false.

attributes.name: two_factor_grace_period
attributes.description: Amount of time (in hours) that users are allowed to skip forced configuration of two-factor authentication.

attributes.name: unique_ips_limit_enabled
attributes.description: (If enabled, requires: unique_ips_limit_per_user and unique_ips_limit_time_window) Limit sign in from multiple IPs.

attributes.name: unique_ips_limit_per_user
attributes.description: Maximum number of IPs per user.

attributes.name: unique_ips_limit_time_window
attributes.description: How many seconds an IP is counted towards the limit.

attributes.name: usage_ping_enabled
attributes.description: Every week GitLab reports license usage back to GitLab, Inc.

attributes.name: user_deactivation_emails_enabled
attributes.description: Send an email to users upon account deactivation.

attributes.name: user_default_external
attributes.description: Newly registered users are external by default.

attributes.name: user_default_internal_regex
attributes.description: Specify an email address regex pattern to identify default internal users.

attributes.name: user_oauth_applications
attributes.description: Allow users to register any application to use GitLab as an OAuth provider.

attributes.name: user_show_add_ssh_key_message
attributes.description: When set to false disable the You won't be able to pull or push project code via SSH warning shown to users with no uploaded SSH key.

attributes.name: version_check_enabled
attributes.description: Let GitLab inform you when an update is available.

attributes.name: whats_new_variant
attributes.description: What’s new variant, possible values: all_tiers, current_tier, and disabled.

attributes.name: web_ide_clientside_preview_enabled
attributes.description: Live Preview (allow live previews of JavaScript projects in the Web IDE using CodeSandbox Live Preview).

attributes.name: wiki_page_max_content_bytes
attributes.description: Maximum wiki page content size in bytes. Default: 52428800 Bytes (50 MB). The minimum value is 1024 bytes.

apis.name: Package Registry: Package file size limits
apis.description: The package file size limits are not part of the Application settings API. Instead, these settings can be accessed using the Plan limits API.
